&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;Accounts receivable, net, is as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The following table summarizes inventories&#13;as of the dates presented:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 9 &amp;#8211; STOCK-BASED COMPENSATION&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Long-Term Equity Incentive Plans&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On May 27, 2015, the Company&amp;#8217;s board&#13;of directors adopted the 2015 Long-Term Incentive Equity Plan (&amp;#8220;2015 Stock Option Plan&amp;#8221;). The 2015 Stock Option Plan&#13;provides for the grant of stock options, stock appreciation rights, restricted stock and other stock-based awards to, among others,&#13;the officers, directors, employees and consultants of the Company. During January 2017, the 2015 Stock Option Plan was amended&#13;to increase the aggregate number of shares authorized for issuance by 283,333 shares to 750,000 shares.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On April 14, 2017, the Company&amp;#8217;s board&#13;of directors adopted the 2017 Long-Term Incentive Equity Plan (&amp;#8220;2017 Stock Option Plan&amp;#8221;), which was approved by the&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s stockholders on August 9, 2017. The 2017 Stock Option Plan provides for the grant of stock options, stock appreciation&#13;rights, restricted stock and other stock-based awards to, among others, the officers, directors, employees and consultants of the&#13;Company. The total number of shares authorized under the 2017 Stock Option Plan is 850,000.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Stock Options&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On January 5, 2017, the Company issued to various&#13;officers, directors, and employees options to purchase an aggregate of 220,867 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock, under&#13;the 2015 Stock Option Plan. The options expire five years from the date of grant, have an exercise price of $5.00, and vest quarterly&#13;over two years, beginning on April 5, 2017. The options have a fair value of $440,698.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On January 30, 2017, pursuant to his consulting&#13;agreement, Mr. Davidson, the Company&amp;#8217;s Former Executive Chairman, was granted an option to purchase 71,686 shares of the&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s common stock. The option expires four and a half years from the date of grant, has an exercise price of $4.09,&#13;and vests in three equal installments on January 30, 2017, July 28, 2017, and July 28, 2018. The option has a fair value of $131,240.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On March 10, 2017, in connection with his amended&#13;and restated employment agreement, Mr. Thomas was granted an option to purchase 75,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock,&#13;under the 2015 Stock Option Plan. The option expires five years from the date of grant and has an exercise price of $4.50 per share.&#13;The option will vest in three annual installments beginning on the date of grant. The option has a fair value of $128,062.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On March 27, 2017, as compensation, the Company&#13;issued to a director an option to purchase 70,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock. The option will expire five years&#13;from the date of grant, has an exercise price of $4.50 per share, and vests in three annual installments beginning on the date&#13;of grant. The option has a fair value of $130,266.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On April 17, 2017, the Company issued to various&#13;officers, directors, and employees options to purchase an aggregate of 127,500 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock under&#13;the 2015 Stock Option Plan and 187,647 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock under the 2017 Stock Option Plan. The options&#13;will expire five years from the date of grant, have an exercise price of $4.50 per share, and vest in three annual installments&#13;beginning on the date of grant. The options have a fair value of $404,600.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On August 24, 2017, the Company issued an option&#13;to purchase 12,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock to an employee of the Company under the 2017 Stock Option Plan. The&#13;option will expire five years from the date of grant and have an exercise price of $3.76. The option vests one-third on the date&#13;of grant and one-third in each November 2017 and 2018. The option has a fair value of $17,693.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On August 24, 2017, the Company issued an option&#13;to purchase 20,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock to an employee of the Company under the 2017 Stock Option Plan. The&#13;option will expire five years from the date of grant, have an exercise price of $3.76 and be fully vested upon issuance. The option&#13;has a fair value of $29,488.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On August 24, 2017, the Company issued to employees&#13;of the Company options to purchase an aggregate of 23,500 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock under the 2017 Stock Option&#13;Plan. The options will expire five years from the date of grant, have an exercise price of $3.76 and vest in three annual installments&#13;beginning on the date of grant. The options have a fair value of $34,649.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On December 24, 2017, a former director exercised&#13;an option to purchase 23,333 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock on a cashless basis. To exercise on a cashless basis, the&#13;former director forfeited 17,471 previously owned shares, resulting in net shares issued of 5,862.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company determined the fair value of stock&#13;options granted based upon the assumptions as provided below.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman

   &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;2.72&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;2.5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;417,407&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Exercisable at December 31, 2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;4.25&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;3.09&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;1.9&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;348,699&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The aggregate intrinsic value is calculated&#13;as the difference between the exercise price of the underlying stock options and the fair value of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;As of December 31, 2017, there was a total&#13;of $162,505 of unrecognized compensation expense related to unvested stock options. This cost is expected to be recognized through&#13;2019 with a weighted average remaining life of 0.49 years.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company accounts for all stock-based compensation&#13;as an expense in the financial statements and associated costs are measured at the fair value of the award or the fair value of&#13;the service provided whichever is most readily determinable.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Stock Warrants &lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On March 29, 2017, in consideration for a prior&#13;commitment for financing the Company through March 31, 2018 from a stockholder, the Company&amp;#8217;s Board of Directors issued to&#13;this stockholder a warrant to purchase 165,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock at an exercise price of $4.18 per share.&#13;This warrant has a term of one year and was fully vested upon issuance. The warrant had a grant date fair value of $172,526, which&#13;was fully charged to general and administrative expense during the three months ended March 31, 2017. The fair value of the warrant&#13;was determined utilizing the Black-Scholes option pricing model, based upon a common stock price of $4.00 per share, dividend yield&#13;of 0%, expected volatility of 70%, risk free interest rate of 1.00%, and an expected life in years of 1.00.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On May 12, 2017, in consideration for a prior&#13;commitment for financing the Company through May 15, 2018 from a stockholder, the Company&amp;#8217;s Board of Directors issued to&#13;this stockholder a warrant to purchase 20,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock at an exercise price of $4.90 per share.&#13;This warrant has a term of one year and was fully vested upon issuance. The warrant had a grant date fair value of $22,039, which&#13;was fully charged to general and administrative expense during the three months ended June 30, 2017. The fair value of the warrant&#13;was determined utilizing the Black-Scholes option pricing model, based upon a common stock price of $4.87 per share, dividend yield&#13;of 0%, expected volatility of 57%, risk free interest rate of 1.11%, and an expected life in years of 1.00.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On April 24, 2017, in connection with a distribution&#13;agreement with Big Geyser (the &amp;#8220;Big Geyser Distribution Agreement&amp;#8221;) (see Note 11), the Company issued a warrant to&#13;purchase 85,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock at an exercise price of $4.50 per share. The warrant vests depending&#13;on certain sales levels achieved by that distributor. The warrant has an expiration date of April 23, 2022. The warrant had a grant&#13;date fair value of $226,134. For the year ended December 31, 2017, the Company recognized expense of $18,975 related to this warrant.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On April 24, 2017, in connection with the same&#13;distribution agreement, the Company issued a second warrant to purchase 95,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock at an&#13;exercise price that will be equal to the average of the closing prices of the common stock for the thirty consecutive trading days&#13;ending on April 23, 2018 (or the 30 days preceding the beginning of the measurement period for this warrant). The warrant vests&#13;depending on certain sales levels achieved by that distributor during the period April 24, 2018 through April 23, 2019. The warrant&#13;has an expiration date of April 23, 2022. The initial valuation of this warrant will not occur until the measurement period begins&#13;on April 24, 2018.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On April 24, 2017, in connection with the same&#13;distribution agreement, the Company issued a warrant to purchase 145,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock at an exercise&#13;price of $4.50 per share. The warrant vests as follows for certain milestones being achieved: 95,000 shares upon the receipt of&#13;the first purchase order of the Company&amp;#8217;s iced tea products, 25,000 shares upon the receipt of the first purchase order of&#13;the Company&amp;#8217;s lemonade products, and 25,000 shares upon the receipt of the first purchase order for half-gallon containers&#13;of the Company&amp;#8217;s products. The warrant has an expiration date of April 23, 2022. The warrant had a grant date fair value&#13;of $385,758. For the year ended December 31, 2017, the Company recorded expense $252,738 related to this warrant.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On July 6, 2017, in connection with the public&#13;offering the Company issued warrants to purchase an aggregate of 40,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock to lead investors&#13;(See Note 1).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On August 16, 2017, in connection with the&#13;Big Geyser Distribution Agreement, the Company issued a warrant to purchase 110,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock&#13;at an exercise price that will be equal to the average of the closing prices of common stock for the thirty consecutive trading&#13;days ending on April 23, 2019 (or the 30 days preceding the beginning of the measurement period for this warrant). The warrant&#13;vests depending on certain sales levels achieved by that distributor during the period April 24, 2019 through April 23, 2020. The&#13;warrant has an expiration date of April 23, 2022. The initial valuation of this warrant will not occur until the measurement period&#13;begins on April 24, 2019.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;The following table summarizes the common stock warrant activity&#13;of the Company:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Number of shares&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Weighted&lt;/font&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&#13;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;average &lt;/font&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&#13;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;exercise price&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Weighted average&lt;/font&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&#13;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;contractual life&lt;/font&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&#13;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;(years)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 43%&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Outstanding - January 1, 2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;270,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;1,474,399&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;1,175,672&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The total amount of stock-based compensation&#13;was reflected within the statements of operations and comprehensive loss as:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The following table summarizes the stock option&#13;activity of the Company:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;The following table summarizes the common stock warrant activity&#13;of the Company:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The computation of diluted earnings per share&#13;excludes outstanding options, warrants and other dilutive instruments in periods where the inclusion of such instruments would&#13;be antidilutive, as provided below:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 5 &amp;#8211; EQUIPMENT LOAN&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 6 &amp;#8211; CREDIT LINES &lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;UBS&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On October 27, 2016, the Company entered into&#13;a credit line with UBS (The &amp;#8220;UBS Credit Line&amp;#8221;). The UBS Credit Line had a borrowing capacity determined by the level&#13;of the collateral pledged and bore interest at a floating rate, depending on the time requested for the borrowing. As of July 21,&#13;2017, the credit line was closed. As of December 31, 2017 and December 31, 2016, the outstanding balance on the line of credit&#13;was $0 and $1,280,275, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Radium2 Capital Inc&lt;/i&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On November 27, 2017, the Company completed&#13;the Radium Agreement with Radium2 Capital Inc. (&amp;#8220;Radium&amp;#8221;). Pursuant to the Radium Agreement, the Company received cash&#13;of $750,000, less $7,500 of fees and expenses. The Radium borrowing is repaid at a minimum amount per week, based upon 15% of the&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s gross sales, until the Company has repaid a total of $986,250. The Agreement further provides for a discount on&#13;the repayment amount, provided such prepay obligation of $838,313 is paid within 126 business days from the date of funding. The&#13;Radium Agreement was accounted for as a borrowing, with the difference between the repayment obligation and the net amount funded&#13;being recorded as an original issue discount, amortized using the interest method over the expected term of the arrangement. As&#13;of December 31, 2017, the balance of the obligation, net of the discount was $688,038, and was presented as note payable, current,&#13;within the consolidated financial statements. Since the repayment terms are based upon the Company&amp;#8217;s actual future sales,&#13;which are not fixed, the Company classified the obligation as a current liability. During the year ended December 31, 2017, accreted&#13;discount amortization was $47,437, and was reflected as interest expense within the consolidated statements of operations and comprehensive&#13;loss.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Court Cavendish Ltd.&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On December 20, 2017, the Company entered into&#13;the Cavendish Loan Agreement with Court Cavendish Ltd (&amp;#8220;Cavendish&amp;#8221;). The Cavendish Loan Agreement provides for the&#13;availability of an initial $2,000,000 (&amp;#8220;Initial Facility Amount&amp;#8221;). Cavendish also agreed to allow for two extensions&#13;of $1,000,000 each (&amp;#8220;Extended Facility Amount&amp;#8221;, and together with the Initial Facility Amount, the &amp;#8220;Facilities&amp;#8221;),&#13;as long as the Company continued moving towards specific ventures related to the blockchain technology, to increase the Facilities&#13;to $4,000,000 subject to Cavendish&amp;#8217;s approval. Interest on the Facilities shall accrue monthly, at a rate of 12.5% per annum,&#13;on the unpaid principal balance commencing on the date of the first drawdown and shall be due and payable, without demand or notice,&#13;at the Company&amp;#8217;s election quarterly in cash or in shares of the Company valued at the lower of $3.00 or the closing price&#13;per share on the preceding date the interest payment is due. All principal and accrued interest under the Facilities is due and&#13;payable on December 21, 2018. On such date, at Cavendish&amp;#8217;s election, the Company shall repay the outstanding amount together&#13;with accrued interest either in cash or in shares of the Company at the lower of $3.00 or the closing price per share on such date,&#13;but not lower than $2.00 per share. In connection with the Cavendish Loan Agreement, a facility fee of 5% (&amp;#8220;Original Issue&#13;Discount&amp;#8221; or &amp;#8220;OID&amp;#8221;) of each of the Initial Facility Amount and the Extended Facility Amount is payable on the&#13;date of the first drawdown under each such facility and payable in either cash or stock. The facility fee on the Initial Facility&#13;Amount of $100,000 was withheld from the proceeds of the initial $750,000 funding under the Cavendish Loan Agreement.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;In connection with the Initial Facility Amount,&#13;the Company issued to Cavendish a warrant to purchase 100,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock with a three year life&#13;and an exercise price of $3.00 per share. This warrant had a gross fair value of $165,645, using the Black-Scholes option pricing&#13;model. Upon the first draw under the Extended Facility Amount, the Company shall issue a warrant to purchase an additional 50,000&#13;shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock, with the same terms, for each of the $1,000,000 extensions that are made available&#13;under the Extended Facility Amount.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The $100,000 fee and the warrant to issue 100,000&#13;shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock were considered costs of the Initial Facility Amount.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;For the Initial Facility Amount, the $100,000&#13;fee was charged in full as a cost of the facility and the warrant was charged on a relative fair value basis, or in the amount&#13;of $152,363. These costs were initially charged to deferred financing costs, since these costs were associated with the Initial&#13;Facility Amount and not to a single funding. Thereafter, these deferred costs shall be charged on a pro rata basis as a direct&#13;offset against the fundings as they occur, and such costs would be amortized using the interest method over the term of each funding&#13;loan.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On December 21, 2017, the Company requested&#13;a funding of $750,000 under the Initial Financing Facility, which was received by the Company on December 22, 2017. OID costs of&#13;$37,500 and warrant costs of $57,136, were from deferred financing costs were directly offset against this funding.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company then evaluated the funding transaction&#13;to determine whether or not there was a beneficial conversion feature. Accordingly, the Company determined that after the effect&#13;of the OID and the warrant, that the effective conversion price was $2.13 per share. With a market price of the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;common stock on December 20, 2017, of $2.44, the Company determined that there was a beneficial conversion with a value of $94,636.&#13;The beneficial conversion feature was accounted for as a credit to additional paid in capital and a direct offset to the funded&#13;loan amount, with such costs amortized using the interest method over the term of each funding loan.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On December 26, 2017, Cavendish converted the&#13;principal of $750,000 and accrued interest and thereupon was issued 250,233 shares, based upon an exercise price of $3.00 per share.&#13;Accordingly, in recording the conversion, the Company recognized $189,272 in interest expense for the unamortized debt discount&#13;and then the principal value of the note of $750,000 was credited to additional paid in capital and common stock.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 8 &amp;#8211; STOCKHOLDERS&amp;#8217; (DEFICIT) EQUITY&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;2016 Issuances&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;From January 1, 2016 to March 14, 2016, the&#13;Company sold 171,725 units to investors at $4.00 per unit for gross proceeds of $686,900. Each unit consists of one share of common&#13;stock and a warrant to purchase one share of common stock. The Company incurred costs of $60,110 related to these sales resulting&#13;in net proceeds of $626,790. As part of these sales 25,000 units were sold to Thomas Cardella, who subsequently became a member&#13;of the Company&amp;#8217;s Board of Directors, and 7,500 shares were sold to Paul Vassilakos, a member of the Board of Directors. The&#13;sales were part of a private placement of up to $3,000,000 of units (the &amp;#8220;Second Offering&amp;#8221;) conducted by the Company&#13;on a &amp;#8220;best efforts&amp;#8221; basis through a placement agent (the &amp;#8220;Placement Agent&amp;#8221;) that commenced on November&#13;24, 2015. The Offering terminated on March 14, 2016.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Placement Agent for the Second Offering&#13;was paid a commission equal to 10% of the aggregate purchase price from the Units sold to investors introduced to the Company by&#13;the Placement Agent. The Company also paid the Placement Agent a non-accountable expense allowance equal to 3% of the aggregate&#13;purchase price from the Units sold to (i) investors introduced to the Company by the Placement Agent and (ii) investors not introduced&#13;to the Company by the Placement Agent who purchase less than $500,000 of Units in the aggregate (together, the &amp;#8220;Covered Investors&amp;#8221;).&#13;From March 1, 2016 through March 14, 2016, the Placement Agent was only entitled to a 3% non-accountable allowance for investors&#13;introduced to our Company by the Placement Agent. In addition, the Placement Agent received warrants to purchase a number of shares&#13;of common stock equal to 10% of the total shares of common stock included in the Units sold in the Second Offering to the Covered&#13;Investors, with an exercise price of $4.50 per share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Each warrant issued pursuant to the Second&#13;Offering entitles the holder to purchase one share of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock at an exercise price of $6.00 per share,&#13;commencing immediately and expiring on November 30, 2018. The exercise price and number of shares of common stock issuable on exercise&#13;of the warrants are subject to standard anti-dilution provisions. The Company, at its option, may call the warrants for redemption,&#13;in whole and not in part, at a price of $0.01 per warrant, if (i) the closing price per share of the common stock is at least $10.00&#13;for 30 consecutive trading days ending on the third business day prior to the notice of redemption or (ii) the common stock is&#13;listed for trading on a national securities exchange and the closing price per share of common stock on the first day of trading&#13;on such exchange is at least $7.50. The right to exercise will be forfeited unless the warrants are exercised prior to the date&#13;specified in the notice of redemption. On and after the redemption date, a record holder of a warrant will have no further rights&#13;except to receive the redemption price for such holder&amp;#8217;s warrant upon surrender of such warrant.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;During the year ended December 31, 2015 and&#13;through March 14, 2016, the Company sold 345,725 units through the Placement Agent. As a result, on March 29, 2016, 34,573 warrants&#13;were issued to the Placement Agent. The warrants have an exercise price of $4.50 per share and expire on October 30, 2020.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On March 29, 2016 and March 31, 2016, the Company&#13;entered into subscription agreements for the sale of 58,750 units for gross proceeds of $235,000 at $4.00 per unit, including 2,500&#13;units sold to family members of Philip Thomas, former CEO and a member of the Board of Directors and 2,500 to a relative of Thomas&#13;Panza, a greater than 10% owner of the Company (the &amp;#8220;March Sales&amp;#8221;). Each unit consists of one share of common stock&#13;and a warrant to purchase one share of common stock. Such subscriptions were closed and funded during April 2016.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Each warrant issued in the March Sales entitles&#13;the holder to purchase one share of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock at an exercise price of $6.00 per share, commencing immediately&#13;and expiring on March 29, 2019. The exercise price and number of shares of common stock issuable on exercise of the warrants are&#13;subject to standard anti-dilution provisions. The Company, at its option, may call the warrants for redemption, in whole and not&#13;in part, at a price of $0.01 per warrant, if (i) the closing price per share of the common stock is at least $10.00 for 30 consecutive&#13;trading days ending on the third business day prior to the notice of redemption or (ii) the common stock is listed for trading&#13;on a national securities exchange and the closing price per share of common stock on the first day of trading on such exchange&#13;is at least $7.50. The right to exercise will be forfeited unless the warrants are exercised prior to the date specified in the&#13;notice of redemption. On and after the redemption date, a record holder of a warrant will have no further rights except to receive&#13;the redemption price for such holder&amp;#8217;s warrant upon surrender of such warrant.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;During the year ended December 31, 2015, the&#13;Company entered into agreements with four members of its Advisory Board. Upon signing the agreement, each Advisory Board Member&#13;was entitled to receive 7,500 shares of common stock. These shares were issued on January 26, 2016.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.05pt; text-align: justify&gt;On December 27, 2016, Long Island&#13;Iced Tea Corp. the Company consummated the December Offering of 406,550 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock (including 2,375&#13;shares being sold to a member of the Board of Directors, through Network 1 Financial Securities, Inc. and Dawson James Securities,&#13;Inc., as underwriters, pursuant to the terms of the underwriting agreement, dated December 21, 2016, between the Company and Network&#13;1, as representative of the underwriters. &lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 11 &amp;#8211; COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Legal Proceedings &lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company is involved in various claims and&#13;legal actions arising from time to time in the ordinary course of business. In the opinion of management, the ultimate disposition&#13;of these matters in the ordinary course of business will not have a material adverse effect on the Company&amp;#8217;s consolidated&#13;financial position, results of operations or cash flows. Legal costs related to these matters are expensed as they are incurred.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&lt;i&gt;Revolution&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On August 1, 2014, an action was filed by LIBB&#13;in the Supreme Court in the State of New York entitled Long Island Brand Beverages LLC v. Revolution Marketing, LLC (&amp;#8220;Revolution&amp;#8221;)&#13;and Ascent Talent, Model Promotion Ltd. LIBB is seeking damages of $10,000,000 for several claims including breach of contract&#13;and fraud occurring during 2014. Revolution has filed a counterclaim for breach of contract and related causes of action, claiming&#13;damages in the sum of $310,880, and seeking punitive damages of $5,000,000. Ascent has filed a pre-answer motion to dismiss LIBB&amp;#8217;s&#13;complaint. LIBB filed papers in opposition and the motion was submitted by March 9, 2015. In addition, Revolution has filed a motion&#13;to amend its answer to include cross-claims against Ascent which were not asserted in its original answer of record. On February&#13;5, 2016, the Court rendered a decision. The motion to dismiss was denied with the exception of two claims which the Court dismissed.&#13;In the same decision, the Court granted a separate motion filed by Revolution to amend its answer to include cross-claims against&#13;Ascent. On June 23, 2017, both defendants filed motions to dismiss based upon delays in producing documents, which were fully submitted.&#13;On August 7, 2017, oral arguments were held. Thereafter, the court denied the motions to dismiss and each of the parties has completed&#13;their discovery. On October 6, 2017, the Company filed a Note of Issue and Certificate of Readiness. The case was been certified&#13;by the court as ready for trial. On November 15, 2017, the Company, Ascent and Revolution entered into a mutual release and settlement&#13;agreement in which all claims and counterclaims were dismissed, with no party having to make any payment to any other party.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&lt;i&gt;Julian Davidson&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On February 20, 2018, Mr. Davidson, informed&#13;the Company that he was seeking compensation as part of his December 2017 separation from the Company. The Company does not believe&#13;that any outstanding compensation is due to Mr. Davidson and has informed him accordingly.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On March 12, 2018, an action was filed by Mr.&#13;Davidson in the District Court for the Southern District of New York entitled Julian Davidson v. Long Blockchain Corp. Mr. Davidson&#13;is seeking to enforce a separation agreement that was purportedly reached in relation to his resignation from the Company on December&#13;31, 2017. Mr. Davidson is also seeking compensation, expense reimbursements, and cash bonus, severance, stock and accelerated vesting&#13;of stock options which he claims was agreed to by the Company. The Company&amp;#8217;s management and legal counsel believe it is too&#13;early to determine the probable outcome of this matter.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;NASDAQ Notices&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On October 9, 2017, the Company received a&#13;notice from the Listing Qualifications Department of the Nasdaq Stock Market (&amp;#8220;NASDAQ&amp;#8221;). The notice stated that the&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s enterprise market value fell below the minimum NASDAQ threshold for thirty consecutive business days. The Company&#13;has 180 calendar days from the notice date to regain compliance with this standard by exceeding the minimum threshold for ten consecutive&#13;business days. The notification has no effect on the listing of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock at this time.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On February 15, 2018, Long Blockchain Corp.&#13;received a notice from the Listing Qualifications Department of NASDAQ stating that NASDAQ had determined to delist the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;securities under the discretionary authority granted to NASDAQ pursuant to NASDAQ Rule 5101. The notification letter stated that&#13;NASDAQ believed that the Company made a series of public statements designed to mislead investors and to take advantage of public&#13;interest in bitcoin and blockchain technology, thereby raising concerns about the Company&amp;#8217;s suitability for exchange listing.&#13;The notification letter also stated that NASDAQ was revoking its prior notification to the Company that it had regained compliance&#13;with the market value of listed securities requirement of Rule 5550(b)(2) (the &amp;#8220;MVLS Rule&amp;#8221;).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;We appealed the foregoing delisting to a NASDAQ&#13;Hearings Panel, which appeal hearing was held on March 22, 2018. On April 10, 2018, the Company was notified that the NASDAQ Hearings&#13;Panel determined to affirm the delisting of our shares from NASDAQ, and suspended trading effective at the open of business on&#13;April 12, 2018. The Company intends to apply for its common stock to be quoted on the OTCQB Market. Effective April 12, 2018, the&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s common stock will be eligible for trading and quotation on the Pink Current Information tier by the OTC Markets&#13;Group Inc. (the &amp;#8220;OTC&amp;#8221;). The Company&amp;#8217;s trading symbol will remain LBCC.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Brokerage Arrangements&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company maintains arrangements with sales&#13;brokers who help with bringing new distributors and retail outlets to the Company and who manage certain customer accounts for&#13;the Company. These sales brokers receive a commission for these services. Commissions to these brokers ranged from 1-5% of collected&#13;sales. In addition, the Company sells its products through alternative vending channels. Commissions resulting from sales through&#13;these channels were $47,802 and $81,254 for the years ended December 31, 2017 and 2016, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Employment Agreements&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On March 10, 2017, the Company entered into&#13;an amended and restated employment agreement with Mr. Thomas, the former CEO. The amended employment agreement had a term that&#13;ran until December 31, 2019. Mr. Thomas would receive a base annual salary of $250,000, and was paid $83,000 upon the signing of&#13;the agreement, and would have been eligible for paid incentive bonuses from the Company. Pursuant to the agreement, Mr. Thomas&#13;was also granted an option to purchase 75,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock (See Note 9). On February 20, 2018, Mr.&#13;Thomas terminated his employment agreement with the Company (See Note 14).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On April 18, 2017, the Company entered into&#13;an employment agreement with Virginia Morris to serve as the Company&amp;#8217;s Chief Sales &amp;#38; Marketing Officer. Pursuant to the&#13;employment agreement, Ms. Morris was awarded an option to purchase 27,500 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock under the&#13;2015 Stock Option Plan, and an additional option to purchase 42,500 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock under the 2017 Stock&#13;Option Plan. The options have an exercise price of $4.50 and would have vested annually in three equal installments beginning on&#13;the date of grant. Ms. Morris was also awarded 25,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock prior to the execution of her&#13;employment agreement for services provided to the Company (See Note 9).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On September 1, 2017, the Company terminated&#13;the employment agreement with Ms. Morris. Pursuant to the employment agreement, Ms. Morris was entitled to receive severance of&#13;two months of her base salary. In satisfaction of the severance obligation, Ms. Morris was issued 22,004 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;common stock. In connection with her termination, Ms. Morris&amp;#8217;s option to purchase 70,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common&#13;stock became fully vested. This option will be forfeited if not exercised by September 1, 2018.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Separation Agreement&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On July 11, 2017, the Company entered into&#13;a separation agreement with Richard Allen, the Company&amp;#8217;s former Chief Financial Officer. Pursuant to the separation agreement,&#13;Mr. Allen continued as the Company&amp;#8217;s Chief Financial Officer until August 15, 2017. Pursuant to the separation agreement,&#13;the Company paid to Mr. Allen on August 8, 2017, $30,834 in cash and on November 28, 2017, issued to Mr. Allen 21,015 shares of&#13;the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock. In addition, 50% of Mr. Allen&amp;#8217;s unvested stock options vested immediately and together&#13;with previously vested options will be exercisable until May 15, 2018. The separation agreement contains provisions for protection&#13;of the Company&amp;#8217;s confidential information and certain non-competition restrictions.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Consulting Agreements&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&lt;i&gt;Julian Davidson&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On June 6, 2016, the Company entered into an&#13;amendment to the consulting agreement with Julian Davidson which provided for him to serve as the Company&amp;#8217;s Executive Chairman.&#13;Pursuant to the consulting agreement, as in effect prior to its amendment and restatement as described below, the Company (a) paid&#13;to Mr. Davidson $10,000 per month, and (b) granted to Mr. Davidson 1,667 shares of common stock per month (an aggregate of 4,302&#13;shares). The consulting agreement, as amended, contained provisions for protection of the Company&amp;#8217;s intellectual property&#13;and confidentiality and non-competition restrictions for Mr. Davidson (generally imposing restrictions during the term of the consulting&#13;agreement, on (i) ownership or management of, or employment or consultation with, competing companies, (ii) soliciting employees&#13;to terminate their employment (iii) soliciting business from the Company&amp;#8217;s customers, and (iv) soliciting prospective acquisition&#13;and investment candidates for purposes of acquiring or investing in such entity).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On August 18, 2016, the Company entered into&#13;a second amendment to the consulting agreement with Julian Davidson. Pursuant to the amendment, upon the Company completing an&#13;equity raise with gross proceeds of at least $6,900,000, the monthly cash fee to Mr. Davidson increases to $20,000 per month, the&#13;monthly stock grant to Mr. Davidson was eliminated and Mr. Davidson received a one-time cash bonus of $95,000 and a one-time grant&#13;of 50,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock. Further, on August 18, 2016, the Company granted to Mr. Davidson an option&#13;to purchase 286,744 shares of common stock.&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On October 5, 2016, the Company entered into&#13;an amended and restated consulting agreement with Julian Davidson (&amp;#8220;Davidson Amendment&amp;#8221;), effective as of September&#13;29, 2016, which provided for him to continue to serve as the Company&amp;#8217;s Executive Chairman.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On October 2, 2017, the Company agreed to pay&#13;Mr. Davidson, in lieu of a cash bonus of $165,000 due to him under his existing compensation arrangements (i) a one-time stock&#13;bonus of 48,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock, valued at $135,768, which were issued in November 2017 and (ii) a deferred&#13;cash payment of $65,000 of which $30,000 was paid in December 2017 and $35,000 was included in accreted expense at December 31,&#13;2017. The shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock were granted under the Company&amp;#8217;s 2017 Long-Term Incentive Equity Plan.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On December 19, 2017, Mr. Davidson resigned&#13;from the Board of Directors and all other positions within the Company, effective December 31, 2017. Upon Mr. Davidson&amp;#8217;s&#13;resignation, all outstanding stock options were forfeited.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.5in; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Investor Relations&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On March 1, 2017, the Company entered into&#13;a consulting agreement with an investor relations and communications firm, which commenced on March 1, 2017, and was terminated&#13;on November 22, 2017. Pursuant to the agreement, during the year ended December 31, 2017, this firm was paid $1,080,000 in cash&#13;and was issued 20,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock, valued at $78,200. As of December 31, 2017, the Company had $183,300,&#13;for the issuance of 40,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock, in accrued expenses within the consolidated balance sheets&#13;due to this firm.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Distribution Agreements&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On March 14, 2017, the Company entered into&#13;the Big Geyser Distribution Agreement. Big Geyser became the exclusive distributor of the Company&amp;#8217;s iced tea products in&#13;certain regions. The agreement became effective on April 24, 2017 and covers retail locations in the New York City metro region,&#13;including the five boroughs of New York City,&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;Long Island, Westchester and Putnam County.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Leases &lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On June 6, 2014, the Company entered into a&#13;lease agreement for its former principal office and warehouse space in Hicksville, NY. The lease commenced on July 1, 2014 and&#13;expired on August 31, 2017.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On July 14, 2017, the Company entered into&#13;a lease agreement for its principal office and warehouse space in Farmingdale, NY. The lease commenced on August 15, 2017 and extends&#13;through September 30, 2022. The Company has the option to extend the lease for an additional three years. Pursuant to the lease&#13;agreement, the first months rent is $8,250 per month, with rent for the first month at no cost. The Company is obligated for taxes&#13;and an annual escalation of 3 %. Rent expense is accounted to on a straight line basis based upon the total expected rent over&#13;the lease term.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Rent expense for the years ended December 31,&#13;2017 and 2016 was $75,989 and $47,655, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Total future minimum payments required under&#13;the Farmingdale lease are as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
