&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 12 &amp;#8211; MAJOR CUSTOMERS AND VENDORS&#13;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;For the years ended December 31, 2017 and 2016,&#13;two customers accounted for 25% and 14%, or 39% in the aggregate, and two customers accounted for 20%, and 11%, or 31% in the aggregate,&#13;of the Company&amp;#8217;s net sales, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The carrying value of financial instruments&#13;in the Company&amp;#8217;s consolidated financial statements are as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 13 - RELATED PARTIES &lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company recorded revenue related to sales&#13;to an entity owned by an immediate family member of Philip Thomas, former CEO, stockholder, and member of the Board of Directors.&#13;Mr. Thomas is also an employee of this entity. For the years ended December 31, 2017 and 2016, sales to this related party were&#13;$879 and $3,451, respectively. As of December 31, 2017 and 2016, there was $879 and $0, respectively, due from this related party&#13;which was included in accounts receivable in the consolidated balance sheets. The Company also purchases product at cost, from&#13;this entity to supplement certain vending sales. For the years ended December 31, 2017 and 2016, the Company purchased $30,084&#13;and $27,557, respectively, of product from this entity. As of December 31, 2017 and 2016, the outstanding balance due to this entity&#13;included in accounts payable was $16,469 and $10,043, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;As of December 31, 2017 and 2016, the Company&#13;is indebted to Mr. Thomas in the amounts of $70,000 and $0, respectively, for an interest-free short-term loan to the Company.&#13;This loan is included in other current liabilities within the consolidated balance sheets.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On March 27, 2017, the Company issued an option&#13;to purchase 70,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock to a party who was, until October 5, 2017, a member of the Board&#13;of Directors, in connection with administrative services provided to the Company beyond the Board of Director duties of this Director.&#13;As of December 31, 2017 and 2016 accounts payable and accrued expenses to a company wholly owned by this former director were $0&#13;and $4,032, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 7 &amp;#8211; LINE OF CREDIT &amp;#8211; RELATED PARTIES&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Brentwood LIIT Corp.&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The following table sets forth the available-for-sale&#13;securities, which were fully liquidated during the year ended December 31, 2017.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 2 - SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING&#13;POLICIES &lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Basis of Presentation &lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The accompanying consolidated financial statements&#13;for the years ended December 31, 2017 and 2016 have been prepared in accordance and in conformity with accounting principles generally&#13;accepted in the United States of America (&amp;#8220;U.S. GAAP&amp;#8221;) and applicable rules and regulations of the Securities and Exchange&#13;Commission (&amp;#8220;SEC&amp;#8221;) regarding consolidated financial information.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Principles of Consolidation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The consolidated financial statements include&#13;the accounts of the Company and its wholly-owned subsidiaries. All inter-company balances and transactions have been eliminated&#13;in the accompanying consolidated financial statements.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Use of Estimates&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The preparation of financial statements in&#13;conformity with U.S. GAAP requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and&#13;liabilities and the disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities as of the date of the financial statements, and also affect&#13;the amounts of revenues and expenses reported for each period. Actual results could differ from those which result from using such&#13;estimates. Management utilizes various other estimates, including but not limited to, assessing the collectability of accounts&#13;receivable, accrual of rebates to customers, the valuation of securities, the valuation of inventory, determining the estimated&#13;lives of long-lived assets, determining the potential impairment of intangibles, the fair value of warrants issued, the fair value&#13;of stock options, the recognition of revenue, and other legal claims and contingencies. The results of any changes in accounting&#13;estimates are reflected in the financial statements in the period in which the changes become evident. Estimates and assumptions&#13;are reviewed periodically and the effects of revisions are reflected in the period that they are determined to be necessary.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Revenue is stated net of sales discounts and&#13;rebates paid to customers (See Customer Marketing Programs including Sign On and Sales Incentives, below). Net sales are recognized&#13;when all of the following conditions are met: (1) the price is fixed and determinable; (2) evidence of a binding arrangement exists&#13;(generally, purchase orders); (3) products have been delivered and there is no future performance required; and (4) amounts are&#13;collectible under normal payment terms.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;These conditions typically occur when the products&#13;are delivered to or picked up by the Company&amp;#8217;s customers. For sales where certain revenue recognition criteria have not been&#13;met at the date of delivery, the Company defers recognition of such revenue and accounts receivable until such recognition criteria&#13;are met.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Customer Marketing Programs, including Sign&#13;On and Sales Incentives&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company participates in various programs&#13;and arrangements with customers designed to incent new distribution, incent the introduction of a new product line, or to increase&#13;the sale of its products. Among these programs are arrangements under which allowances can be earned by customers for introducing&#13;a product (sign on incentives, for example), for various discounts to the end retailers or for participating in specific marketing&#13;programs. The Company believes that its participation in these programs is essential to ensuring volume and revenue growth in a&#13;competitive marketplace. Depending upon the program, those incentives are paid in either cash or the issuance of equity instruments.&#13;During the years ended December 31, 2017 and 2016, these allowances resulted in reductions in net sales of $960,298 and $310,089,&#13;respectively. Included in these amounts for the years ended December 31, 2017 and 2016 are costs of $271,713 and $0, respectively,&#13;representing the non-cash costs of a sign-on incentive, presented net of mark-to-market adjustments for unvested awards related&#13;to warrants issued in connection with the signing of a distribution agreement and the first order with Big Geyser Inc. (&amp;#8220;Big&#13;Geyser&amp;#8221;) (See Notes 9 and 11).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Shipping and Handling Costs&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Shipping and handling costs incurred to move&#13;finished goods from the Company&amp;#8217;s sales distribution centers to customer locations are included in selling and marketing&#13;expenses within the consolidated statements of operations and comprehensive loss and totaled $815,266 and $420,389, for the years&#13;ended December 31, 2017 and 2016, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Advertising&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company expenses advertising costs as incurred.&#13;Advertising costs are included in selling and marketing expenses within the consolidated statements of operations and comprehensive&#13;loss and totaled $687,245 and $151,438 for the years ended December 31, 2017 and 2016, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Research and Development &lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Costs related to new product initiatives incurred&#13;were included in selling and marketing expenses within the consolidated statements of operations and comprehensive loss and totaled&#13;$359,554 and $192,857 for the years ended December 31, 2017 and 2016, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Operating Leases&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;The Company records rent related to its operating leases on a straight&#13;line basis over the lease term.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Cash&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company considers all highly liquid instruments&#13;with an original maturity of three months or less when acquired to be cash equivalents.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Short-term Investments&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company accounts for securities in accordance&#13;with accounting standards for investments in debt and equity securities. Accounting standards require investments in debt and equity&#13;securities to be classified as either &amp;#8220;held to maturity&amp;#8221;, &amp;#8220;trading&amp;#8221;, or &amp;#8220;available-for-sale.&amp;#8221;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company may hold investments in marketable&#13;securities, consisting of U.S. government securities and mutual funds. The Company&amp;#8217;s available-for-sale securities were carried&#13;at estimated fair value with any unrealized gains and losses, net of deferred taxes, included in accumulated other comprehensive&#13;income (loss) in stockholders&amp;#8217; (deficit) equity, when applicable. During the years ended December 31, 2017 and 2016, respectively,&#13;the unrealized gain/(loss) was $30,246 and $(30,246), respectively. Realized losses are charged against interest and other income/(expense),&#13;net, when a decline in fair value is determined to be other-than-temporary. The Company has not recorded any such impairment charge&#13;in the periods presented. The Company determines realized gains or losses on sale of marketable securities on a specific identification&#13;method, and records such gains or losses as interest and other income/(expense), net.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The following table sets forth the available-for-sale&#13;securities, which were fully liquidated during the year ended December 31, 2017.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Times
 Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Unrealized&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Cost&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;195,374&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Restricted Cash&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;As of December 31, 2016, the Company had cash&#13;balances of $103,603 that were pledged against the Company&amp;#8217;s UBS Credit Line.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Accounts Receivable&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company sells products to distributors&#13;and in certain cases directly to retailers, and extends credit, generally without requiring collateral, based on its evaluation&#13;of the customer&amp;#8217;s financial condition. While the Company has a concentration of credit risk in the retail sector, it believes&#13;this risk is mitigated due to the diverse nature of the customers it serves, including, but not limited to, its type, geographic&#13;location, size, and beverage channel. Potential losses on the Company&amp;#8217;s receivables are dependent on each individual customer&amp;#8217;s&#13;financial condition and sales adjustments granted after the balance sheet date. The Company carries its trade accounts receivable&#13;at net realizable value. Accounts receivable have terms of ranging from 30 to 75 days and do not bear interest. The Company monitors&#13;its exposure to losses on receivables and maintains allowances for potential losses or adjustments. The Company determines these&#13;allowances by (1) evaluating the aging of its receivables; (2) analyzing its history of sales adjustments; and (3) reviewing its&#13;high-risk customers. Past due receivable balances are written off when the Company&amp;#8217;s efforts have been unsuccessful in collecting&#13;the amount due. Accounts receivable are stated at the amounts management expects to collect.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;Accounts receivable, net, is as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times
