   &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Losses&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Fair Value&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 49%&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;U. S. government securities&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 14%; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;195,570&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 14%; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;(196&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 14%; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;195,374&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Fixed income mutual funds&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;2,224,197&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;(30,050&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;2,194,147&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Total&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;2,419,767&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;(30,246&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;2,389,521&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;The following table classifies the US government securities by maturity:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Accounts Receivable&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company sells products to distributors&#13;and in certain cases directly to retailers, and extends credit, generally without requiring collateral, based on its evaluation&#13;of the customer&amp;#8217;s financial condition. While the Company has a concentration of credit risk in the retail sector, it believes&#13;this risk is mitigated due to the diverse nature of the customers it serves, including, but not limited to, its type, geographic&#13;location, size, and beverage channel. Potential losses on the Company&amp;#8217;s receivables are dependent on each individual customer&amp;#8217;s&#13;financial condition and sales adjustments granted after the balance sheet date. The Company carries its trade accounts receivable&#13;at net realizable value. Accounts receivable have terms of ranging from 30 to 75 days and do not bear interest. The Company monitors&#13;its exposure to losses on receivables and maintains allowances for potential losses or adjustments. The Company determines these&#13;allowances by (1) evaluating the aging of its receivables; (2) analyzing its history of sales adjustments; and (3) reviewing its&#13;high-risk customers. Past due receivable balances are written off when the Company&amp;#8217;s efforts have been unsuccessful in collecting&#13;the amount due. Accounts receivable are stated at the amounts management expects to collect.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;Accounts receivable, net, is as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Concentrations of Credit Risk&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Financial instruments which potentially subject&#13;the Company to concentrations of credit risk consist principally of cash on deposit with financial institutions and accounts receivable.&#13;At times, the Company&amp;#8217;s cash in banks is in excess of the FDIC insurance limit. The Company has not experienced any loss&#13;as a result of these cash deposits. These cash balances are maintained with one bank. The Company is exposed to credit risk with&#13;regard to two customers who accounted for 18% and 10%, or 28% in the aggregate, as of December 31, 2017, and one customer who accounted&#13;for 46% of the Company&amp;#8217;s trade receivables as of December 31, 2016. The Company does not generally require collateral or&#13;other security to support customer receivables.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Inventories &lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company&amp;#8217;s inventory includes raw&#13;materials such as bottles, sweeteners, labels, flavors and packaging. Finished goods inventory consists of bottled iced tea, lemonade&#13;and ALO Juice. As of December 31, 2017 and 2016, included in inventory was finished goods inventory with a cost, net of inventory&#13;reserve, of approximately $201,000 and $320,000, respectively, which has been delivered to one or more of the Company&amp;#8217;s distributors&#13;and is held in inventory until certain revenue recognition criteria are met.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0.5pt 0 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company values its inventories at the lower&#13;of cost or net realizable value. Cost is determined using the first-in, first-out (FIFO) method. As of December 31, 2017 and 2016,&#13;the Company recorded inventory reserves, of $200,775 and $45,078, respectively, to reduce the cost of certain products to estimated&#13;net realizable value. The following table summarizes inventories as of the dates presented:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Property and Equipment&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Property and equipment is recorded at cost.&#13;Major property additions, replacements, and betterments are capitalized, while maintenance and repairs that do not extend the useful&#13;lives of an asset or add new functionality are expensed as incurred. Depreciation is recorded using the straight-line method over&#13;the respective estimated useful lives of the Company&amp;#8217;s assets.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Intangible Assets &lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;As of December 31, 2017 and 2016, the Company&#13;tested the domain name utilizing the qualitative method. Based on this analysis, it was determined that there were no indicators&#13;of impairment as of December 31, 2017 and 2016.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;During September 2017, the Company recorded&#13;an indefinite lived intangible asset representing for the value of the ALO Juice intellectual property. However, at December 31,&#13;2017, the Company tested the fair value of the ALO intangible asset and determined that it was fully impaired as of such date,&#13;because the Company has de-emphasized the sale of its ALO business in order to better manage its liquidity. During the year ended&#13;December 31, 2017, the Company recorded a charge of $150,000 as an impairment of this intangible asset.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company accounts for income taxes in accordance&#13;with FASB ASC 740, &amp;#8220;Income Taxes&amp;#8221; (&amp;#8220;ASC 740&amp;#8221;). ASC 740 requires an asset and liability approach for financial&#13;accounting and reporting for income taxes and established for all the entities a minimum threshold for financial statement recognition&#13;of the benefit of tax positions, and requires certain expanded disclosures. The provision for income taxes is based upon income&#13;or loss after adjustment for those permanent items that are not considered in the determination of taxable income. Deferred income&#13;taxes represent the tax effects of differences between the financial reporting and tax basis of the Company&amp;#8217;s assets and&#13;liabilities at the enacted tax rates in effect for the years in which the differences are expected to reverse. The Company evaluates&#13;the recoverability of deferred tax assets and establishes a valuation allowance when it is more likely than not that some portion&#13;or all the deferred tax assets will not be realized. Management makes judgments as to the interpretation of the tax laws that might&#13;be challenged upon an audit and cause changes to previous estimates of tax liability. In management&amp;#8217;s opinion, adequate provisions&#13;for income taxes have been made. If actual taxable income by tax jurisdiction varies from estimates, additional allowances or reversals&#13;of reserves may be necessary.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Based on the Company&amp;#8217;s evaluation, it&#13;has been concluded that there are no significant uncertain tax positions requiring recognition in the Company&amp;#8217;s consolidated&#13;financial statements. The evaluation was performed for the 2017 and 2016 tax years. The Company believes that its income tax positions&#13;and deductions will be sustained on audit and does not anticipate any adjustments that will result in a material change to its&#13;financial position or results of operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company&amp;#8217;s policy for recording interest&#13;and penalties associated with tax audits is to record such items as a component of income tax expense. There were no amounts accrued&#13;for penalties and interest for years ended December 31, 2017 and December 31, 2016. The Company does not expect its uncertain tax&#13;position to change during the next twelve months. Management is currently unaware of any issues under review that could result&#13;in significant payments, accruals or material deviations from its position.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On December 22, 2017, the U.S. government enacted&#13;comprehensive tax legislation commonly referred to as the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act (the &amp;#8220;Tax Act&amp;#8221;). The Tax Act makes&#13;broad and complex changes to the U.S. tax code that potentially will affect the Company&amp;#8217;s fiscal year ending December 31,&#13;2018.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Loss per share&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Basic net loss per common share is computed&#13;by dividing net loss by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding. Diluted earnings per share reflect, in periods&#13;in which they have a dilutive effect, the impact of common shares issuable upon the exercise of stock options, warrants and the&#13;conversion. The computation of diluted earnings per share excludes those with an exercise price in excess of the average market&#13;price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common shares during the periods presented. The computation of diluted earnings per share excludes&#13;outstanding options, warrants and other dilutive instruments in periods where the inclusion of such instruments would be antidilutive,&#13;as provided below:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Fair Value of Financial Instruments&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The carrying amounts of cash, short term investments,&#13;accounts receivable, automobile and equipment loans approximate fair value due to the short-term nature of these instruments. In&#13;addition, for notes payable, the Company believes that interest rates approximate prevailing rates.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;ASC 820 &amp;#8220;Fair Value Measurements and&#13;Disclosures&amp;#8221; provides the framework for measuring fair value. That framework provides a fair value hierarchy that prioritizes&#13;the inputs to valuation techniques used to measure fair value. The hierarchy gives the highest priority to unadjusted quoted prices&#13;in active markets for identical assets or liabilities (level 1 measurements) and the lowest priority to unobservable inputs (level&#13;3 measurements).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Fair value is defined as an exit price, representing&#13;the amount that would be received upon the sale of an asset or payment to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between&#13;market participants. Fair value is a market-based measurement that is determined based on assumptions that market participants&#13;would use in pricing an asset or liability. A three-tier fair value hierarchy is used to prioritize the inputs in measuring fair&#13;value as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Level 1 Quoted prices in active markets for&#13;identical assets or liabilities.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Level 2 Quoted prices for similar assets or&#13;liabilities in active markets, quoted prices for identical or similar assets or liabilities in markets that are not active, or&#13;other inputs that are observable, either directly or indirectly.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Level 3 Significant unobservable inputs that&#13;cannot be corroborated by market data.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Fair values for short-term money market investments&#13;are determined from quoted prices in active markets for these money market funds, and are considered to be Level 1.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The carrying value of financial instruments&#13;in the Company&amp;#8217;s consolidated financial statements are as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Stock Based Compensation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company accounts for stock based compensation&#13;in accordance with ASC 718, Compensation - Stock Compensation (&amp;#8220;ASC 718&amp;#8221;). ASC 718 establishes accounting for stock-based&#13;awards exchanged for employee services. Under the provisions of ASC 718, stock based compensation cost is measured at the grant&#13;date, based on the fair value of the award, and is recognized as expense over the employee&amp;#8217;s requisite service period (generally&#13;the vesting period of the equity grant). The fair value of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock options are estimated using the Black&#13;Scholes option-pricing model with the following assumptions: expected volatility, dividend rate, risk free interest rate and the&#13;expected life. The Company calculates the expected volatility using the historical volatility of the Company over the most recent&#13;period equal to the expected term and evaluates the extent to which available information indicates that future volatility may&#13;differ from historical volatility. The expected dividend rate is zero as the Company does not expect to pay or declare any cash&#13;dividends on common stock. The risk-free rates for the expected terms of the stock options are based on the U.S. Treasury yield&#13;curve in effect at the time of the grant. The Company has not experienced significant exercise activity on stock options. Due to&#13;the lack of historical information, the Company determined the expected term of its stock option awards issued using the simplified&#13;method.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The simplified method assumes each vesting&#13;tranche of the award has a term equal to the midpoint between when the award vests and when the award expires. The Company expenses&#13;stock-based compensation by using the straight-line method.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company accounts for stock options granted&#13;to consultants pursuant to the accounting guidance included in ASC 505-50 &amp;#8220;Equity-Based Payments to Non-Employees&amp;#8221;&#13;(&amp;#8220;ASC 505-50&amp;#8221;). Stock-based compensation cost is measured at the grant date and at the end of each reporting period&#13;for unvested awards, based on the fair value of the award, and is recognized as expense over the consultant&amp;#8217;s requisite service&#13;period (generally the vesting period of the equity grant). The fair value of the Company&amp;#8217;s stock options granted to consultants&#13;are estimated using the Black Scholes option-pricing model with the following assumptions: expected volatility, dividend rate,&#13;risk free interest rate and the expected life.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Recent Accounting Standards&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;In January 2016, the Financial Accounting Standards&#13;Board (&amp;#8220;FASB&amp;#8221;), issued Accounting Standards Update (&amp;#8220;ASU&amp;#8221;) 2016-01, &amp;#8220;Financial Instruments-Overall&#13;(Subtopic 825-10): Recognition and Measurement of Financial Assets and Financial Liabilities,&amp;#8221; which amends the guidance&#13;in U.S. generally accepted accounting principles on the classification and measurement of financial instruments. Changes to the&#13;current guidance primarily affect the accounting for equity investments, financial liabilities under the fair value option, and&#13;the presentation and disclosure requirements for financial instruments. In addition, the ASU clarifies guidance related to the&#13;valuation allowance assessment when recognizing deferred tax assets resulting from unrealized losses on available-for-sale debt&#13;securities. The new standard is effective for fiscal years and interim periods beginning after December 15, 2017, and is to be&#13;adopted by means of a cumulative-effect adjustment to the balance sheet at the beginning of the first reporting period in which&#13;the guidance is effective. Early adoption is not permitted except for the provision to record fair value changes for financial&#13;liabilities under the fair value option resulting from instrument-specific credit risk in other comprehensive income. The Company&#13;expects that the adoption of the ASU will not have a material impact upon the Company consolidated financial statements.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;In February 2016, the FASB issued new lease&#13;accounting guidance (ASU No. 2016-02, Leases). Under the new guidance, at the commencement date, lessees will be required to recognize&#13;a lease liability, which is a lessee&amp;#8217;s obligation to make lease payments arising from a lease, measured on a discounted basis;&#13;and a right-of use asset, which is an asset that represents the lessee&amp;#8217;s right to use, or control the use of, a specified&#13;asset for the lease term. The new guidance is not applicable for leases with a term of 12 months or less. Lessor accounting is&#13;largely unchanged. Public business entities should apply the amendments in ASU 2016-02 for fiscal years beginning after December&#13;15, 2018, including interim periods within those fiscal years. Early application is permitted upon issuance. Lessees (for capital&#13;and operating leases) and lessors (for sales-type, direct financing, and operating leases) must apply a modified retrospective&#13;transition approach for leases existing at, or entered into after, the beginning of the earliest comparative period presented in&#13;the financial statements. The modified retrospective approach would not require any transition accounting for leases that expired&#13;before the earliest comparative period presented. Lessees and lessors may not apply a full retrospective transition approach. The&#13;Company is currently evaluating the impact the adoption of this standard will have on its consolidated financial statements.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;In May 2014, the FASB issued ASU No. 2014-09,&#13;Revenue from Contracts with Customers (Topic 606) which has subsequently been amended by ASU 2015-14, ASU 2016-08, ASU 2016-10,&#13;ASU 2016-12, and ASU 2017-13. These ASUs outline a single comprehensive model for entities to use in accounting for revenue arising&#13;from contracts with customers and supersedes most current revenue recognition guidance, including industry-specific guidance. The&#13;guidance includes a five-step framework that requires an entity to: (i) identify the contract(s) with a customer, (ii) identify&#13;the performance obligations in the contract, (iii) determine the transaction price, (iv) allocate the transaction price to the&#13;performance obligations in the contract, and (v) recognize revenue when the entity satisfies a performance obligation. In July&#13;2015, the FASB deferred the effective date of ASU 2014-09 to annual reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2017. Early&#13;adoption will be permitted as of annual reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2016, including interim reporting periods&#13;within those annual periods. A full retrospective or modified retrospective approach is required. In addition, the new guidance&#13;will require enhanced disclosures, including revenue recognition policies to identify performance obligations to customers and&#13;significant judgments in measurement and recognition.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company has elected to apply the modified&#13;retrospective method and the impact was determined to be immaterial on the consolidated financial statements. Accordingly, the&#13;new revenue standard will be applied prospectively in our consolidated financial statements from January 1, 2018 forward and reported&#13;financial information for historical comparable periods will not be revised and will continue to be reported under the accounting&#13;standards in effect during those historical periods.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company has performed an analysis and identified&#13;its revenues and costs that are within the scope of the new guidance. The Company anticipates that its current methods of recognizing&#13;revenues will not be significantly impacted by the new guidance.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;In January 2017, the FASB issued ASU 2017-01,&#13;&amp;#8220;Clarifying the Definition of a Business&amp;#8221; (&amp;#8220;ASU 2017-01&amp;#8221;), which provides guidance to assist entities with&#13;evaluating whether transactions should be accounted for as acquisitions (or disposals) of assets or businesses. ASU 2017-01 requires&#13;entities to use a screen test to determine when an integrated set of assets and activities is not a business or if the integrated&#13;set of assets and activities needs to be further evaluated against the framework. ASU 2017-01 is effective for fiscal years beginning&#13;after December 15, 2017, including interim periods within those years. The Company believes that the adoption of the ASU may have&#13;an impact on the Company as it pursues its strategy to develop the blockchain business.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Total future minimum payments required under&#13;the Farmingdale lease are as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 14 &amp;#8211; SUBSEQUENT EVENTS&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Employment Agreement&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Effective February 20, 2018, the Company&#13;appointed Shamyl Malik as Chief Executive Officer of the Company. Mr. Malik will remain a member of the Board of Directors. The&#13;Company and Mr. Malik entered into a one-year employment agreement, pursuant to which Mr. Malik will receive a base annual salary&#13;of $250,000, and for the first six months of his employment, his salary will be paid in shares of common stock of the Company.&#13;For the remaining six months, Mr. Malik&amp;#8217;s salary will be payable in cash, shares of common stock or a combination thereof,&#13;at the sole option of Mr. Malik. Additionally, if Mr. Malik is still employed by the Company on January 1, 2019, he will be entitled&#13;to a guaranteed bonus of $250,000, half of which will be payable in shares of common stock and half in cash, or in any combination&#13;thereof approved by Mr. Malik.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Termination of Employment Agreement&#13;with Executive&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On February 20, 2018, Phillip Thomas&#13;terminated his employment agreement with the Company for &amp;#8220;good reason&amp;#8221; due to a substantial and material adverse change&#13;in Mr. Thomas&amp;#8217; title, duties and responsibilities, and resigned as a director of the Company. According to Mr. Thomas&amp;#8217;&#13;employment agreement, he is entitled to be paid nine months of his base salary, all valid expense reimbursements and all accrued&#13;but unused vacation pay. Further, stock options granted to Mr. Thomas became fully vested and may be exercised up to one year from&#13;the termination date.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Issuance of Stock Options&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On February 19, 2018, the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;board of directors approved the issuance of stock options to various employees to purchase 22,500 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;common stock. The options expire five years from the date of grant, have an exercise price of $3.23 per share, and vest one-third&#13;on date of grant and one-third in each of February 2019 and February 2020. These options have a grant date fair value of $51,156.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Issuance of Common Stock&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On March 9, 2018, the Company issued&#13;87,546 shares of common stock to members of the advisory board and board of directors of the Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On March 9, 2018, the Company issued&#13;56,158 shares of common stock to employees and consultants of the Company.&lt;br style=clear: both /&gt;&#13;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Hashcove Merger&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On March 15, 2018, the Company entered&#13;into a sale and purchase agreement (the &amp;#8220;Hashcove Agreement&amp;#8221;), as amended, on March 16, 2018, with the shareholders&#13;(collectively, the &amp;#8220;Shareholders&amp;#8221;) of Hashcove Limited (&amp;#8220;Hashcove&amp;#8221;).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Hashcove is an early stage UK-based&#13;technology company focused on developing and deploying globally scalable distributed ledger technology solutions. Among its planned&#13;product offerings, Hashcove is developing tokenized platforms, crypto-exchanges and wallets, smart contracts for initial coin offerings&#13;(&amp;#8220;ICO&amp;#8221;), know-your-customer (&amp;#8220;KYC&amp;#8221;) and financial clearing technology on blockchain, and other related&#13;blockchain applications. Upon closing, which the Company expects will occur by the third quarter of 2018, Hashcove will become&#13;a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Pursuant to the Hashcove Agreement,&#13;the Company is purchasing (the &amp;#8220;Hashcove Purchase&amp;#8221;) the entire issued share capital of Hashcove from the Hashcove Shareholders.&#13;In exchange, the Company will issue 531,250 shares of common stock of the Company to the Hashcove Shareholders. Additionally, the&#13;Shareholders may earn up to an aggregate of 1,533,750 of additional shares of common stock of the Company (the &amp;#8221; Contingent&#13;Shares &amp;#8220;) upon the achievement of the following milestones: (a) if (i) the Company&amp;#8217;s net revenue (as defined in the&#13;Agreement) equals or exceeds $10,000,000 during any 12-calendar month period beginning six months after the closing (as defined&#13;below) and ending no later than 36 months after the closing; (ii) Hashcove&amp;#8217;s net revenue equals or exceeds $5,000,000 during&#13;any 12-calendar month period beginning six months after the closing and ending no later than 36 months after the closing; or (iii)&#13;the closing sale price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock equals or exceeds $8.00 for a minimum of 30 consecutive trading days&#13;during the 36 months following the closing, the Shareholders shall receive an aggregate of an additional 1,135,312 shares of common&#13;stock of the Company; and (b) if Hashcove completes the crypto exchange, ICO smart contract solution, &amp;#8220;clearing on blockchain&amp;#8221;&#13;and &amp;#8220;KYC on blockchain&amp;#8221; products in accordance with the Agreement during the 24 months following the closing, the Shareholders&#13;shall receive an aggregate of an additional 398,438 shares of common stock of the Company. The Contingent Shares will be placed&#13;in escrow at the Closing and will be released to the Shareholders upon achievement of the applicable milestones.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Upon the Closing, Kunal Nandwani, Hashcove&amp;#8217;s&#13;Chief Executive Officer, will become an executive officer and director of the Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Shareholders have agreed to certain&#13;restrictions on transfer of the shares they receive under the Agreement.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company has also agreed to file,&#13;as promptly as practicable in its reasonable discretion following the closing, a registration statement with the SEC registering&#13;the resale of the shares of common stock of the Company to be issued to the Shareholders pursuant to the Agreement and agreed to&#13;seek to have such registration statement declared effective by the SEC as promptly as practicable thereafter.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Stater Blockchain&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On March 19, 2018, the Company entered&#13;into a contribution and exchange agreement (the &amp;#8220;Stater Agreement&amp;#8221;), with Stater Blockchain Limited (&amp;#8220;SBL&amp;#8221;),&#13;and simultaneously closed the transactions contemplated thereby.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;SBL is a New Zealand-based technology&#13;company focused on developing and deploying globally scalable blockchain technology solutions in the financial markets. SBL is&#13;developing multiple blockchain and digital currency technology solutions, such as its &amp;#8220;Smart Settlements&amp;#8221; and &amp;#8220;Smart&#13;KYC&amp;#8221; platforms, for the global financial markets where significant disintermediation opportunities exist. SBL owns Stater&#13;Global Markets, a United Kingdom-based Financial Conduct Authority regulated prime-of-prime brokerage, which facilitates market&#13;access across multiple instruments including foreign exchange, exchange traded futures and contracts for difference.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Pursuant to the Stater Agreement, SBL&#13;issued to the Company 99 ordinary voting shares in SBL (&amp;#8220;SBL Shares&amp;#8221;) which, immediately following completion of the&#13;transaction contemplated by the Stater Agreement, constituted 9.9% of the total SBL Shares then issued and outstanding, in exchange&#13;for 1,135,435 shares of common stock of the Company, which constituted 9.9% of the total LBC Shares then issued and outstanding&#13;(the &amp;#8220;Exchange&amp;#8221;).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Upon closing, Shamyl Malik, the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;Chief Executive Officer, was appointed as a director of SBL and Ramy Soliman, SBL&amp;#8217;s Chief Executive Officer, was appointed&#13;as a director of the Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Upon closing, the Company, SBL and the&#13;majority shareholder of SBL entered into a shareholders&amp;#8217; agreement (the &amp;#8220;Stater Shareholders&amp;#8217; Agreement&amp;#8221;),&#13;governing the management and ownership of SBL. The Stater Shareholders&amp;#8217; Agreement includes the Company&amp;#8217;s right to appoint&#13;one director of SBL, so long as the Company holds at least 9.9% of the SBL Shares then on issue, certain restrictions on transfer&#13;and preemptive rights with respect to the issuance of new securities of SBL.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Upon closing, the Company, SBL and Long&#13;Island Iced Tea Corp. (&amp;#8221; SpinCo &amp;#8220;) entered into a voting agreement (the &amp;#8220;Voting Agreement&amp;#8221;), pursuant to&#13;which SBL agreed, if necessary, to vote its LBC Shares (i) in favor of the Company&amp;#8217;s distributing the shares of common stock&#13;of SpinCo held by it (the &amp;#8220;SpinCo Shares &amp;#8220;) to the Company&amp;#8217;s stockholders by way of a dividend (the &amp;#8220;Spinoff&amp;#8221;),&#13;and/or (ii) if requested by the Company against any agreement which would prevent the Spinoff. Additionally, until the earlier&#13;of (i) one year from the consummation of the Spinoff or (ii) the date on which SpinCo Shares become listed on a national securities&#13;exchange, in the event any vote of SpinCo&amp;#8217;s stockholders is necessary to effectuate any corporate action, SBL agreed to vote&#13;the SpinCo Shares it directly or indirectly receives upon consummation of the Spinoff (i) in favor of any corporate action recommended&#13;by the then existing board of directors of SpinCo and/or (ii) against any action or agreement which would impede, interfere with&#13;or prevent any SpinCo Action from being consummated. Pursuant to the Voting Agreement, SBL also agreed to appoint the Company or&#13;SpinCo as the Stockholder&amp;#8217;s proxy to vote SBL&amp;#8217;s LBC Shares or SpinCo Shares, as applicable, if so requested by the&#13;Company. The voting requirements set forth in the Voting Agreement shall expire if the Spinoff is not consummated by November 13,&#13;2018 or if prior to such date, the Company&amp;#8217;s board of directors unanimously decides not to proceed with the Spinout.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Agreement with CASHe &lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.05pt; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On March 22, 2018, the Company entered&#13;into and closed on a contribution and exchange agreement (the &amp;#8220;CASHe Agreement&amp;#8221;), with TSLC PTE Ltd. (&amp;#8220;TSLC&amp;#8221;).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;TSLC is the parent company of CASHe,&#13;a leading provider of digital money and short-term financial products to young millennials across India. TSLC also owns all of&#13;the intellectual property developed by CASHe and has the worldwide rights outside of India to the application of its intellectual&#13;property for its lending and money transfer platform.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;CASHe provides short-term financial&#13;products using technology combined with analytics and proprietary algorithms to map young professionals across the country based&#13;on their mobile, digital footprint and their social behaviour patterns&amp;#160;to rate their credit worthiness. CASHe has also implemented&#13;distributed ledger enabled digital tokens using smart contracts on its lending platform.&amp;#160;The distributed ledger technology&#13;allows the platform to record transactions in a secure and transparent manner by creating an audit trail. Further, a smart contract-based&#13;distributed ledger records all lending transactions in an open and transparent manner.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Pursuant to the CASHe Agreement, TSLC&#13;issued the Company 1,145,960 shares of its voting capital stock (the &amp;#8220;TSLC Capital Stock&amp;#8221;), equal to 7.00% of the TSLC&#13;Capital Stock on a fully diluted basis, in exchange for (i) 1,949,736 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock, equal to 17.00%&#13;of the Company&amp;#8217;s total common stock issued and outstanding as of the date of the CASHe Agreement, and (ii) the right to receive,&#13;if a Material Adverse Effect (as defined in the CASHe Agreement) occurs with respect to the Company within ninety (90) days of&#13;the date of the CASHe Agreement, an additional 332,602 shares of the company&amp;#8217;s common stock, equal to 2.90% of the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;total issued and outstanding common stock as of the date of the CASHe Agreement. As of April 12, 2018, the Company was delisted&#13;from NASDAQ, which triggered the Material Adverse Effect under the CASHe Agreement, and therefore the Company owes to TSLC an additional&#13;332,602 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Pursuant to the CASHe Agreement, one&#13;person from TSLC will be appointed to the Company&amp;#8217;s board of directors. As of the date that these financial statements were&#13;issued, no TSLC representative has been appointed to the Company&amp;#8217;s board of directors.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Pursuant to the CASHe Agreement, TSLC&#13;agreed to vote its Company common stock received pursuant to the CASHe Agreement (i) in favor of the Company&amp;#8217;s previously&#13;announced Spinoff of our beverage business, and/or (ii) if requested by us against any agreement which would prevent the Spinoff.&#13;Additionally, until the earlier of (i) one year from the consummation of the Spinoff or (ii) the date on which the shares of the&#13;spun off business (the &amp;#8220;SpinCo Shares&amp;#8221;) become listed on a national securities exchange, in the event any vote of the&#13;stockholders of the spun off business is necessary to effectuate any corporate action, TSLC agreed to vote the SpinCo Shares it&#13;directly or indirectly receives upon consummation of the Spinoff (i) in favor of any corporate action recommended by the then existing&#13;board of directors of the spun off business (each a &amp;#8220;SpinCo Action&amp;#8221;) and/or (ii) against any action or agreement which&#13;would impede, interfere with or prevent any SpinCo Action from being consummated.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Pursuant to the CASHe Agreement, TSLC&#13;granted the Company the rights to develop the business of CASHe in the Latin American market, subject to the parties entering into&#13;a mutually acceptable license agreement having terms customary for such agreements, including, without limitation, those relating&#13;to payment of license fees and royalties by us to TSLC (which terms have not yet been negotiated).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company agreed (a) to use our reasonable&#13;best efforts to file a registration statement to register the resale of the Company common stock issued pursuant to the CASHe Agreement&#13;as soon as practicable and have such registration statement declared effective as soon as possible thereafter and, (b) file any&#13;necessary notices with the OTC Markets, relating to the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock as soon as reasonably possible to allow shares&#13;issued pursuant to the CASHe Agreement to be traded on the OTC.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/106% Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Advances from Related Parties&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/106% Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/106% Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;As of April 12, 2018, the Company is indebted&#13;to Mr. Thomas, the Company&amp;#8217;s former CEO and a shareholder of the Company, in the amount of $220,000.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/106% Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/106% Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 3 - PROPERTY AND EQUIPMENT &lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Times

 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 4 &amp;#8211; AUTOMOBILE LOANS &lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 10 &amp;#8211; INCOME TAXES &lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Deferred income taxes are provided for the&#13;differences between the basis of assets and liabilities for financial reporting and income tax purposes. A valuation allowance&#13;is established when necessary to reduce deferred tax assets to the amount expected to be realized.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The tax effects of temporary differences that&#13;give rise to significant portions of the deferred tax assets and deferred tax liabilities are as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=6 style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;For the year ended December 31,&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Deferred tax assets:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 62%; padding-left: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Net operating loss carry forwards&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 16%; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;2,451,031&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;5,954&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;A reconciliation of the provision for income&#13;taxes with the amounts computed by applying the statutory Federal income tax to income from operations before provision for income&#13;taxes is as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

   &lt;td colspan=6 style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;For the year ended December 31,&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13; background-color: #CCEEFF&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Permanent differences:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-left: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Financing costs- warrant amortization&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;1.9&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;3.4&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-left: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Stock options&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;2.2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;%&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-left: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Other&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;0.3&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;1.1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-left: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Loss on inducement&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;%&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;5.9&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Valuation allowance&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;34.4&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;28.4&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;Effective tax rate&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 10pt&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Internal Revenue Code Section 382 imposes limitations&#13;on the use of net operating loss carryovers (&amp;#8220;NOLs&amp;#8221;) when the stock ownership of one or more 5% shareholders (shareholders&#13;owning 5% or more of the Company&amp;#8217;s outstanding capital stock) has increased on a cumulative basis by more than 50 percentage&#13;points.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On March 28, 2017, the stock ownership of one&#13;or more 5% shareholders (shareholders owning 5% or more of the Company&amp;#8217;s outstanding capital stock) had increased on a cumulative&#13;basis by more than 50 percentage points, triggering a limitation under Section 382. Provided that certain requirements for business&#13;continuity are met, upon a change of ownership under Section 382, the cumulative net operating losses would be subject to an annual&#13;limitation based upon the fair value of the Company multiplied by the long-term tax exempt bond rate. The Company determined that&#13;this annual limitation was de minimis. Accordingly, the Company&amp;#8217;s NOLs in the aggregate gross amount of $11,427,095 were&#13;not eligible to be carried forward past the date of the Section 382. This resulted in an impairment of the NOL carryover amount.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Based on a history of cumulative losses at&#13;the Company and the results of operations for the years ended December 31, 2017 and 2016, the Company determined that it is more&#13;likely than not that it will not realize benefits from the deferred tax assets. The Company will not record income tax benefits&#13;in the consolidated financial statements until it is determined that it is more likely than not that the Company will generate&#13;sufficient taxable income to realize the deferred income tax assets. As a result of the analysis, the Company determined that a&#13;full valuation allowance against the deferred tax assets was required. The Company recognized a deferred tax expense of $1,467,847&#13;to reflect the reduced U.S. tax rate of the Tax Act and a corresponding deferred tax benefit to reflect the reduction of the valuation&#13;allowance. As of December 31, 2017, the Company has recorded a valuation allowance of $3,278,188.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;As of December 31, 2017, the Company had net&#13;operating loss carryforwards for federal and state income tax purposes of approximately $9,145,639 and $9,145,639, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company remains subject to examination&#13;by tax authorities for tax years 2014 through 2016. The Company files income tax returns in the U.S. federal jurisdiction and approximately&#13;11 states.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Operating Leases&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Cash&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Restricted Cash&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;i&gt;Deferred Financing Costs &lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;i&gt;Management&amp;#8217;s Evaluation of Subsequent Events&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Property and equipment are as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The total amount of stock-based compensation&#13;was reflected within the statements of operations and comprehensive loss as:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The tax effects of temporary differences that&#13;give rise to significant portions of the deferred tax assets and deferred tax liabilities are as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 12pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;A reconciliation of the provision for income&#13;taxes with the amounts computed by applying the statutory Federal income tax to income from operations before provision for income&#13;taxes is as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

/**
 * Rivet Software Inc.
 *
 * @copyright Copyright (c) 2006-2011 Rivet Software
 Inc. All rights reserved.
 * Version 2.4.0.3
 *
 */
var Show = {};
Show.LastAR = null
Show.hideAR = function(){
	Show.LastAR.style.display = 'none';
};
Show.showAR = function ( link
 id
 win ){
	if( Show.LastAR ){
		Show.hideAR();
	}
	var ref = link;
	do {
		ref = ref.nextSibling;
	} while (ref && ref.nodeName != 'TABLE');
	if (!ref || ref.nodeName != 'TABLE') {
		var tmp = win ?
			win.document.getElementById(id) :
			document.getElementById(id);
		if( tmp ){
			ref = tmp.cloneNode(true);
			ref.id = '';
			link.parentNode.appendChild(ref);
		}
	}
	if( ref ){
		ref.style.display = 'block';
		Show.LastAR = ref;
	}
};
Show.toggleNext = function( link ){
	var ref = link;
	do{
		ref = ref.nextSibling;
	}while( ref.nodeName != 'DIV' );
	if( ref.style &&
		ref.style.display &&
		ref.style.display == 'none' ){
		ref.style.display = 'block';
		if( link.textContent ){
			link.textContent = link.textContent.replace( '+'
 '-' );
		}else{
			link.innerText = link.innerText.replace( '+'
 '-' );
		}
	}else{
		ref.style.display = 'none';
		if( link.textContent ){
			link.textContent = link.textContent.replace( '-'
 '+' );
		}else{
			link.innerText = link.innerText.replace( '-'
 '+' );
		}
	}
};








/* Updated 2009-11-04 */
/* v2.2.0.24 */
/* DefRef Styles */
..report table.authRefData{
	background-color: #def;
	border: 2px solid #2F4497;
	font-size: 1em;
	position: absolute;
}
..report table.authRefData a {
	display: block;
	font-weight: bold;
}
..report table.authRefData p {
	margin-top: 0px;
}
..report table.authRefData .hide {
	background-color: #2F4497;
	padding: 1px 3px 0px 0px;
	text-align: right;
}
..report table.authRefData .hide a:hover {
	background-color: #2F4497;
}
..report table.authRefData .body {
	height: 150px;
	overflow: auto;
	width: 400px;
}
..report table.authRefData table{
	font-size: 1em;
}
/* Report Styles */
..pl a
 .pl a:visited {
	color: black;
	text-decoration: none;
}
/* table */
..report {
	background-color: white;
	border: 2px solid #acf;
	clear: both;
	color: black;
	font: normal 8pt Helvetica
 Arial
 san-serif;
	margin-bottom: 2em;
}
..report hr {
	border: 1px solid #acf;
}
/* Top labels */
..report th {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
	text-align: center;
}
..report th.void	{
	background-color: transparent;
	color: #000000;
	font: bold 10pt Helvetica
 Arial
 san-serif;
	text-align: left;
}
..report .pl {
	text-align: left;
	vertical-align: top;
	white-space: normal;
	width: 200px;
	white-space: normal; /* word-wrap: break-word; */
}
..report td.pl a.a {
	cursor: pointer;
	display: block;
	width: 200px;
	overflow: hidden;
}
..report td.pl div.a {
	width: 200px;
}
..report td.pl a:hover {
	background-color: #ffc;
}
/* Header rows... */
..report tr.rh {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
}
/* Calendars... */
..report .rc {
	background-color: #f0f0f0;
}
/* Even rows... */
..report .re
 .report .reu {
	background-color: #def;
}
..report .reu td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}
/* Odd rows... */
..report .ro
 .report .rou {
	background-color: white;
}
..report .rou td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}
..report .rou table td
 .report .reu table td {
	border-bottom: 0px solid black;
}
/* styles for footnote marker */
..report .fn {
	white-space: nowrap;
}
/* styles for numeric types */
..report .num
 .report .nump {
	text-align: right;
	white-space: nowrap;
}
..report .nump {
	padding-left: 2em;
}
..report .nump {
	padding: 0px 0.4em 0px 2em;
}
/* styles for text types */
..report .text {
	text-align: left;
	white-space: normal;
}
..report .text .big {
	margin-bottom: 1em;
	width: 17em;
}
..report .text .more {
	display: none;
}
..report .text .note {
	font-style: italic;
	font-weight: bold;
}
..report .text .small {
	width: 10em;
}
..report sup {
	font-style: italic;
}
..report .outerFootnotes {
	font-size: 1em;
}
